metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9517 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to unconstrained interal data buffering, potentially leading to a denial of service. The attacker opens the HTTP/2 window so the peer can send without constraint; however, they leave the TCP window closed so the peer cannot actually write (many of) the bytes on the wire. The attacker then sends a stream of requests for a large response object. Depending on how the servers queue the responses, this can consume excess memory, CPU, or both.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9517` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> apache2 2.4.18 in xenial does not build mod_http2

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10').
